      • multipleInputs

        public static java.lang.String[] multipleInputs​(javax.swing.JFrame frame,
                                                java.lang.String[] lab,
                                                java.lang.String tit)
        multipleInputs with Labels. The number of input fields is equal the number of the given lab array.
        Parameters:
        frame - - JFrame the calling frame (owner) or NULL
        lab - - string array for Labels
        tit - - String, Title
        Returns:
        String array of inputs (incl. empty strings)

      • multipleInputs

        public static java.lang.String[] multipleInputs​(javax.swing.JFrame frame,
                                                java.lang.String[] lab,
                                                java.lang.Object[] obj,
                                                java.lang.String tit)
        multipleInputs with Labels and defaults. The number of input fields is equal the number of the given lab array.
        defaults can be null.
        Parameters:
        frame - - JFrame the calling frame (owner) or NULL
        lab - - string array for Labels
        obj - - Default object array (object as a string or a string array
        tit - - String, Title
        Returns:
        String array of inputs (incl. empty strings)

      • dynamicInputs

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> dynamicInputs​(javax.swing.JFrame frame,
                                                             java.lang.String tit)
        dynamicInputs. Return a list of inputs (String) if OK or CLOSE is clicked.
        Previous inputs can be modified at anytime.
        Note: all leading and ending blanks are truncated. Input with 0 length is ignored.
        Parameters:
        frame - JFrame, null to display JOptions in the center of screen
        tit - title String
        Returns:
        list of input string (without empty string)

      • dynamicInputs

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> dynamicInputs​(javax.swing.JFrame frame,
                                                             java.lang.String tit,
                                                             int msgType)
        dynamicInputs. Return a list of inputs (String) if OK or CLOSE is clicked.
        Previous inputs can be modified at anytime.
        Note: all leading and ending blanks are truncated. Input with 0 length is ignored.
        Parameters:
        frame - JFrame, null to display JOptions in the center of screen
        tit - title String
        msgType - int, JOptionPane.MessageType (e.g. JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE, JOptionPane.QUESTION_MESSAGE, etc.)
        Returns:
        list of input string (without empty string)

      • login

        public static java.lang.String[] login​(javax.swing.JFrame frame,
                                       java.lang.String header)
        login
        Parameters:
        frame - JFrame, null to display JOptions in the center of screen
        header - String
        Returns:
        String array contains: string[0]: user ID, string[1]: Password, or null (X-CLOSE)
